intro: Houstonia triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and along stream banks. Houstonia triflora is often found in clusters, with its low-growing habit making it a characteristic ground cover in its native habitat.
